SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your dictation.

1. Your full name: ARTHUR CHARLES DOUGLAS
2. Your address: 5B DUPLEX PIONEER LODGE, ASSINIBOIA SASK
3. Date: March 23rd 1963
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Wokingham Berkshire England
5. What was your father's name and occupation? Edward Douglas was a ploughman.
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): around 1904
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: I came from England in 1903, stayed in Manitoba about 1 year
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.) I was 24 years old or thereabouts when I came to Saskatchewan.
9. What were your reasons for coming West? Because of the boom that was being given Manitoba in England.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)
1. Your full name: ARTHUR G CHARLES DOUGLAS

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): Wiltshire, England

5. What was your father's name and occupation? EDWARD CHARLES DOUGLAS

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): around 1904

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may say "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)

9. What were your reasons for coming West?

Because of the boom that was going on in England

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   They didn't mind.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   By myself.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   The railroad.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   I cannot remember.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   Possibly in Prince.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   Across the Saskatchewan River from Stanley, but did not return to settle on it.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.
   Moose Jaw, Barry, Glenworth, Woodrow, Palmer, Waskam, & Railway lived in.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   Working for a farmer in Montana, also two years after coming to Saskatchewan was an elevator agent for well-known grain companies at various points in the province.
   And when the last year broke out in Saskatchewan, I was employed at the Waskam airport, which closed to be.
   I was caretaker for the new school at Waskam until my retirement in 1958.

19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   Occasionally to an only child in England also to a cousin there.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.
    (Mrs.) Alice Jane Farmer, living in Aldershot, Hampshire, on July 24th, 1925.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place to settle?
    Not that I know of.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.
    Yes

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
    When I visualize what the city of Regina looked like when I came to the province and compare it to today, I can hardly realize what a tremendous change has taken place in the space of a few years. As I knew it then, it was nothing we call a city, more like streets had so much mud that it engulfed the wheels of the wagons.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
    I didn't have to travel for business or to attend church services or visiting friends, the latter time I was able to stay along in the communities in which I lived.

   I saw the first car come to Regina.

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?
   Not until living in Saskatoon during the year following the last year of the Saskatchewan Telephone Co.

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   Made up my mind to stay in Sask. upon arriving in 1904. I cast my first vote here in 1905 when it became a province, and I have enjoyed very much living in this province.

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

Having electricity, & now so many labour saving electrical appliances, for the farm & housewife, & for use in the commercial world. & the labour saving farm machinery that has taken the place of the horses & ploughs.
